Title: Data Analyst, Safety & Secruity
RoleDescription:
This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday- Thursday, with remote flexibility on Fridays.
The Data Analyst, Global Safety & Security will play a critical role in supporting investigations into loss prevention and asset protection by analyzing data to identify trends, anomalies, and potential bad actors. This role will serve as an analytical subject matter expert, helping investigators interpret exception reporting and build data-driven evidence for cases.
The ideal candidate is highly adaptable, detail-oriented, and proficient in data manipulation and analysis. They should be comfortable working with ambiguous datasets, identifying actionable insights, and collaborating with both technical and operational teams to enhance security data capabilities.
What You'll Do:
Data Analysis & Investigations Support

Act as a data analyst specializing in loss prevention investigations, supporting Wayfairs Global Safety & Security (GLOSS) team.
Analyze structured and unstructured datasets to identify potential fraud, theft, or policy violations.
Work closely with investigators and leadership to gather business requirements for exception reporting and case-building insights.
Develop and maintain data pipelines, reports, and dashboards that provide investigators with real-time, actionable intelligence.

Technical Data Processing & Reporting

Design, implement, and optimize SQL queries and scripts to extract and analyze data from multiple sources.
Identify key metrics and exception flags that help improve security investigations and reduce false positives.
Maintain and enhance reporting dashboards to ensure they deliver accurate, relevant, and timely insights.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Workflow Optimization

Partner with technical and operational stakeholders to identify correct data sources, improve data accuracy, and streamline security workflows.
Support global security data projects by optimizing existing workflows and implementing new data-driven approaches.
Travel to Wayfairs supply chain, retail, and corporate locations as needed to assist with data implementations and security initiatives.

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related discipline).
Experience writing SQL queries to analyze and manipulate datasets.
Strong analytical skill set, with the ability to write scripts, define key data points, and build meaningful reports.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders.
Ability to balance independent, focused coding work with collaborative meetings and team discussions.
Comfortable working in ambiguous, fast-paced environments where problem-solving and adaptability are critical.
Ability to travel up to 15% within the U.S. as required.
Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, or holidays as necessary.
Ability to remain in a stationary position for extended periods (e.g., sitting or standing).
Ability to move about within an office, store, or warehouse environment.
Ability to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. as needed.

Preferred Qualifications:

Background in retail, supply chain, logistics, or eCommerce.
Proficiency with Google BigQuery, Looker, Google Analytics, or other data visualization tools.

Title: Labor Planning Manager
RoleDescription:
The Labor Planning Manager plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

Title: Assistant Store Manager, Retail Operations
RoleDescription:
Assistant Store Manager, Logistics & Inventory Operations - Wayfair Branded Stores
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
 
The salary range for this position is $57,000-$70,000 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. 
 
Overview: As an Assistant Store Manager (ASM), youll take a leading role in bringing Wayfairs retail vision to life within a high-performing sales and customer centric environment. Reporting to the Department Manager, you will oversee critical store functions for teams, and assist across team verticals including operational excellence, visual merchandising and design, and team development, to ensure an exceptional customer experience, drive a high performance team, and deliver on overall business targets.
This position blends strategic leadership (approx 60%) with hands-on execution and tactical (approx 40%) requiring a balance of creativity, business acumen, and strong leadership. Youll leverage data-driven insights to implement merchandising strategies, optimize store operations, and inspire your team to exceed expectations in every areafrom sales to service. Your contributions will directly impact the stores success by fostering a collaborative, customer-focused culture that reflects the brands values.
The ideal candidate thrives in leading large teams, in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. They should be excited to excel while balancing priorities, and have a proven track record of coaching, mentoring, and developing talent to achieve results. Join Wayfair to help lead, innovate, and shape the in-store experience as we redefine the definition of retail excellence.
 
What Does an Assistant Store Manager (ASM) Do?

Adapt Under Pressure: Excel in managing competing priorities, navigating high-pressure situations with poise and efficiency, and ensuring seamless store operations and team productivity.
Demonstrate Operational Versatility: Demonstrate expertise in overseeing store functions, including sales performance, asset protection, safety compliance, and customer engagement, from opening through closing of daily store operations. Serve as a keyholder to help open or close the store as needed.
Execute Sales-Driven Leadership: Leverage a deep understanding of proactive sales environments and proven tactics to strategically inspire, motivate, and lead teams to exceed performance goals and deliver exceptional results.
Coach and Develop Teams: Youll embody strong leadership and professional maturity while providing actionable feedback and guidance across all teams to drive strong business results and foster associate growth. This will also include accountability conversations and coaching in-the-moment to ensure all team members meet expectations and demonstrate the Wayfair People Principles at all times.
Lead a First-in-Class Experience: Represent a deep understanding of Wayfairs customer-first commitment through product knowledge to assist customers, collaborate with all teams, and deliver an authentic, friendly, and memorable shopping experience.
Possess Organizational Proficiency: Show high proficiency in organization, planning, communication, and relationship management abilities, with a talent for appropriately organizing in-store teams to execute against priorities.


Analytical Thinking: Ability to interpret sales trends, evaluate data, and implement strategies to drive business growth and strategically problem solve.


Embrace Innovation: Bring energy and creativity to the role by sharing ideas to improve operations within our operating guardrails to help enhance brand recognition, product presentation, and adapt to a fast-paced environment with evolving selection, promotions, and competing priorities.


What are the Specific Responsibilities of a Logistics ASM?

Inventory Accuracy: Maintain accurate tracking and organization of inventory across the sales floor and back of house, ensuring optimal stock levels and operational efficiency. You will also coordinate your teams to oversee furniture assembly.
Price and Audit Management: Verify product pricing accuracy and conduct regular audits to identify and address discrepancies, ensuring compliance and consistency.
Inbound and Receiving Operations: Oversee incoming shipments, including product quality and quantity verification, accurate inventory counts, and timely stock integration.
Returns and Exception Management: Manage the returns process, addressing inventory discrepancies and ensuring proper documentation, restocking, or disposal of items as needed.
Picking and Fulfillment Coordination: Supervise the picking and preparation of items for the sales floor, minimizing errors and ensuring timely replenishment.
Outbound and Reverse Logistics: Coordinate the efficient dispatch of goods and returns to meet Wayfair Global Supply Chain standards.
Utilize Technological Competency: Quickly learn software, technology, or new platforms effectively, including mobile apps, portable devices, Google Workspace, and/or intraoffice communication tools.


What are the Job Requirements?

1+ year of previous experience leading a team (10-30+ individuals)
2+ years of previous leadership experience motivating a team of high performers to achieve strong business results through Visual Merchandising and Brand Presentation (such as a store leader, manager, or trainer.)
3+ years of prior retail experience (preference for home, furnishing, and interior design spaces.) 
You will be required to work a flexible schedule that may include nights, weekends, and holidays.


Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

Physical Demands

Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs, ladders, and balance
Ability to use a variety of hand-held tools (such as, but not limited to, wire cutter, wire strippers, screwdrivers, hammer, measuring tape, leveler, drill). 

Working Environment

Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
Occasional noise and vibrations
Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

401(k) with company match (up to 4%) 
Eligible tuition reimbursement (after 6 months of employment)
Wayfair Employee discount
Discount at instore dining cafe
Paid / unpaid parental leave options
Regular upskilling and trainings for your continued development

Asia Partner Solutions at Wayfair is a nimble, fast-paced, ambitious team and drives real-time, material impact on the business. You must have an interest in innovating to solve business problems creatively and a willingness to hit the ground running.
For this role, we are seeking a problem-solving, entrepreneurial individual to manage the supplier acquisition and business partnership development for our Asia-based Supplier program. In this role, youll work with external partners, our suppliers, and internal cross-functional teams to set up and onboard suppliers onto Wayfair. You will own the overall supplier acquisition process, from identifying the lead to negotiating supplier partnership contracts. You will be working closely with senior members of the organization to influence and execute the strategy for the program overall.
What You'll Do 

Execute the steps necessary to setup business development conversations with suppliers on Wayfair
Communicating with suppliers (email, phone) as needed throughout setup process
Managing relationships with our external partners who provide supplier leads and resources for suppliers
Problem solve challenges or trends as they arise
Report on progress of the Acquisition team, including successes and learnings
Work with cross-functional teams to drive a better supplier experience
Influence the strategy and planning for the Asia-based Supplier Acquisition team

Title: Merchant  - Experienced Graduates (Spring/Summer 2025 Start)
RoleDescription:
Additional Details:

This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation (Monday - Thursday) with 1 day remote (Friday).
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN

As a Merchant, you will develop, execute and drive annual and seasonal assortment strategies for your categories. In this role, you will be responsible for category ownership and product curation, influencing how your category comes to life across all Wayfair marketing channels (catalog, digital, social media, and Physical Retail), ensuring accurate product representation and appropriate shelf placement. As a Merchant you will foster strong cross functional relationships to ensure all strategies and goals are achieved, acting as the representative of the customer in strategic decisions on the cross-functional team. The Merchant will partner with teams across Brand Management, Category Management, Creative, Marketing, Analytics & Operations, and external suppliers to ensure the strategic vision is executed all the way to the customer. Leveraging both data-driven qualitative and quantitative insights, you'll make a direct impact on overall sales, Wayfair share gains, and inspire and empower customers to create a home just right for them.  
What you'll do on any given day as a merchant...
As a Merchant, you will build, curate, and maintain category assortment strategies for our marketing channels, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting and iterating on the product offering (own identifying and filling assortment gaps from strategic supplier catalogs). You will ultimately decide what products should be highlighted and amplified across all marketing channels with crisp business justification to support your selections and in alignment with key stakeholders. You will study the competitive market and collaborate with cross-functional partners in order to shape and solidify the direction for your category and to ensure it is competitive in product and price.  You are the product expert - you know our customers needs better than anyone else for your category and are constantly thinking about what tomorrows best sellers will be to continue to surprise and delight our target market.
Your success requires tenacity, agility, speed, an analytical mindset, collaboration, influence, and a competitive spirit. You'll use your executive presence to work with and influence stakeholders at all levels and navigate interesting, complex assortment challenges. You will own the performance results though regularly monitoring assortment health though various KPIs and OKRs. 
What Youll Do 

Build and maintain category assortment strategies, inclusive of developing a shelf space plan and actively selecting, developing and iterating on the product offering.
Identify opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, trend research, and internal performance monitoring as data points.
Partner closely with Category Management, Creative, and Brand teams, as well as external suppliers, to determine how best to bring the selection to life in digital, print, and stores.
Maintain a close pulse on trends and customer needs to identify new assortment opportunities. Find products that deliver compelling newness and have potential to be tomorrows best sellers.
Own the financial outcomes for the performance of the products you placed on the premium shelf spaces. Regularly assess performance and revise assortment and shelf space allocation strategy as needed.  
Challenge the status quo and always be on the lookout for ways to streamline and improve the efficiency of existing processes while effectively managing multiple stakeholders.
Support market research opportunities for category growth, utilizing competitive analysis, competitor shopping, and internal performance monitoring as data points.
Manage sample requests to our retail lab and inspect products for quality control.
Travel 2-4 times per year to attend industry trade shows relevant to your categories to partner with strategic suppliers, visit Wayfair stores, and competitive shop.

What Youll Need
Basic Qualifications

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience.
Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future. 

Preferred Qualifications

Experience within a retail and/or omni-channel buying role with demonstrated growth trajectory of P&L size and scope of category/team responsibility.
Experience buying trend-driven categories, curating assortments from a wide range of vendors and classifications, and developing compelling assortment presentations are all highly preferred.
Strong ability to analyze data and think critically about the business, understand and interpret performance trends, and apply learnings to the business.  
Strong creative sense, elevated taste level, and love of product.  A genuine passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Personable and energetic communication/persuasion skills and ability to influence internal and external stakeholders to align behind and execute against a common goal.
Capable of thriving in a high-growth environment in which defining clarity amidst ambiguity and operating in scrappy start-up building mode are everyday activities.  Demonstrated experience piloting and implementing new processes and hiring/staffing new teams are a plus.
Self-starter motivated by the potential to define a creative and strategic vision and have an outsized impact within a team and company.
Ability to work from Wayfairs Boston headquarters 4 days per week (remote 1 day a week), with travel for competitor diligence, trade shows, and/or vendor meetings.

Possible Team Placements 
Specialty Retail Brands
Wayfairs Specialty Retail Brands (AllModern, Birch Lane, Joss & Main) target the $60B specialty furniture market and are incremental to Wayfair LLC. These brands provide a tightly curated assortment of highly stylish and elevated quality products for the style-obsessed specialty customer.  SRB Merchandising teams own the full category strategy for relevant verticals on one of the three brands below:

AllModern: AllModern is the destination for the best of modern design in a simple, streamlined experience. We believe good design should be the standard for all, not a luxury for the few  so were making modern simple.
Birch Lane: At Birch Lane, we curate a thoughtfully handpicked assortment of furniture & decor that showcases our fresh take on traditional - unlike anything else in the marketplace. We strive to bring our customers a breadth of classic styles made relevant for today and attainable for everyone.
Joss & Main: Joss & Main is a specialty retail brand catering to home decor enthusiasts. It is the ultimate style edit for home  a curated mix of the latest looks and trends in home furnishings, made attainable via fast, free shipping and great prices.

Title: HR Business Partner (Manager)
RoleDescription:
This hybrid position will be based in our Boston office Monday- Thursday, with remote flexibility on Fridays.
Our mission as a Global Talent Management organization is to support our people as individuals, members of teams, and as part of Wayfair. We seek to enhance productivity and retention by promoting employee welfare and inclusion, fostering collaboration and innovation, and driving employee professional growth - reflecting our commitment to our key business drivers, our customers, and our shareholders.
As a true business partner to our leaders, you will be tasked with providing strategic input, insight and advice on the people pillars and the impacts that our people have on the success of our site.  You will tackle existing and potential future challenges through detailed understanding of the business objectives, key metrics, and KPIs driving success across your site(s).
What You'll Do
Serve as a business partner to key mid-level stakeholders in the corporate supply chain and physical retail organizations.  This is a global role which will require partnership with talent functions abroad and basic international employment concepts.  You will support your departments with the employee lifecycle which includes selection, onboarding, development, performance management, and off boarding.  You will also own project management, program development, compliance monitoring, and analytical reviews; along with leading and developing your own team.

Lead, develop and manage local Talent team
Serve as the business partner for stakeholders (line managers), providing objective advice, coaching, and counseling on talent programs, policy and procedures, employment/labor laws, conflict resolution, change management, and organizational development to those stakeholders but also to all employees
Lead and resolve employee relations matters to include harassment and ethics investigations, escalating when appropriate, while considering risk mitigation.
Manage performance related activities and compensation modifications
Superuser of data to identify and report out on trends and insights, making recommendations to stakeholders and cross-functional partners and contributing to solutions that improve business results
Support execution of established and cyclical programs such as Performance and Compensation Cycles, Talent Planning, etc., initiating talent intervention to drive success
Develop and implement new talent programs tied to engagement and retention strategies 
Support org design and structural changes to ensure consistency.
Lead the Retail organizations expansion strategies, serving as the Project Manager for Talent initiatives (program development, policy creation, etc.) and drive scalability.  This would include new store openings and closings which requires some travel.
Serve as a backup for our Supply Chain Communications function, editing content and deploying communications as needed 
Proactively stay connected to the business and Operations teams by attending regularly occurring meetings, and identify relevant initiatives that require communication and/or talent support and guidance
Participate on additional project teams, workstreams, SteerCos, tasks, and initiatives as assigned.

What You'll Need

5+ years in a dedicated HR role with 3+ years of HR management experience
Bachelors degree in Human Resources Management or related field required
Ability to travel approximately / an average of 25% of the time
PHR, SPHR, or SHRM-CP preferred
Program design and project management experience preferred
Experience leading and developing a direct team
Ability to build productive relationships and influence all levels of the organization
Outstanding interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Service orientation with a consultative lens
Ability to analyze, interpret, manipulate data as it relates to the HR function
Comfortable adapting to change in a fast-paced, dynamic and ambiguous environment
Ability to use independent judgment, problem-solve, be creative and committed to results

Title: Economist II
RoleDescription:
Join our Pricing team and play a crucial role in shaping Wayfair's pricing strategy! We're a science team with a mission to optimize long-term profitability by finding the perfect balance between short-term profitability and sustainable customer growth. We do this by leveraging economic theory, cutting-edge ML, econometrics, and live experimentation to ensure our pricing is competitive, fair to our suppliers, and drives customer engagement.
In this role, you'll be pushing the boundaries of demand estimation and causal inference by working with rich, high-volume customer data and ML tools. You'll use both observational and experimental methods to understand how customer short- and long-term price sensitivity shifts in response to various business decisions. Partnering with our engineering team, you'll implement these best-in-class approaches as scalable solutions that drive impact by improving Wayfair pricing strategies. 
What youll do

Lead R&D effort to develop innovative demand estimation approaches that will extend current capabilities and develop new ML products to power our pricing.
Understand our pricing strategy and optimization algorithm to identify what to measure and how to measure it.
Work highly cross-functionally with business leadership, stakeholders, and partner science and engineering teams to drive the integration of model outputs into company-wide business decision-making and existing production systems. 
Developing robust solutions to infer or recover causal relationships from observational data, in a way that minimizes self-selection or third-variable problems and reliance on experimental data. 
Develop and own communication strategy for both technical and business stakeholders (including executive documentation and progress updates)
Act as a subject matter expert and thought leader on demand estimation and causal inference techniques 
To stay ahead of the curve, you'll continuously research and evaluate new techniques in data science, machine learning, and pricing optimization.

Who you are

PhD in Economics, Statistics or other quantitative field with an emphasis on causal inference and/or structural modeling (e.g. industrial organization, structural labor, quantitative marketing, OR).
2 years of experience working as a professional ML or research scientist in causal inference. Consistent track record of autonomous delivery of DS/ML projects that drive measurable business impact. 
Collaborative team player who wants to see themselves and others thrive. 
Expertise in causal inference and interest in bringing best-in-class solutions to e-commerce space. 
Takes a customer-centric approach to ideation and problem-solving
Track-record of influencing non-technical stakeholders on strategic direction by leveraging data-driven insights; excellent written and verbal communication.
Strategic thinker with a customer-centric mindset and a desire for creative problem solving, looking to make a big impact in a growing organization
Strong SQL skills and excellent software engineering skills in Python
Nice-to-haves:
Experience with GCP (BigQuery, GCS, Dataproc, Notebooks), Airflow, and containerization (Docker)
Experience building scalable data processing pipelines with big data tools such as Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.

Title: Product Manager, Orchestration and Planning Tech
RoleDescription:
Who We Are [Orchestration and Planning Tech]
The Optimization team within the Orchestration and Planning Tech (OPT) STO is responsible for selecting the optimal fulfillment plan throughout the customer purchase journey at Wayfair. This involves designing algorithms and building scalable systems that select the fulfillment plan and optimize orders as they move through the fulfillment process to ensure the best possible customer outcomes.
Within Optimization, the Plan Outputs team plays a critical role as the interface between Supply Chain Technology and external consumers of the fulfillment plan. Once a fulfillment plan is selected, the Plan Outputs team ensures that this information is accurately and efficiently communicated to teams within and outside of Supply Chain Tech  including Storefront, Browse, and third-party partners like Google.
By enabling real-time fulfillment plan communication across these systems, the Plan Outputs team ensures that customers receive clear, reliable delivery expectations throughout their shopping journey, directly influencing trust, conversion, and satisfaction. 
 
What Youll Do

Fulfillment Plan Communication: Act as the key bridge between Fulfillment Optimization and customer-facing teams to ensure fulfillment selection decisions (e.g., shipping dates, delivery promises) are accurately and clearly represented to consumers.
Cross-System Alignment: Aligning fulfillment inputs with pricing and inventory management systems to drive better cost optimization and ensure consistent business logic across platforms.
Formalizing Fulfillability Criteria: Defining clear criteria for when products are considered fulfillable or unfulfillable to improve product findability and maintain customer trust. 
Leading Cross-Functional Initiatives: Acting as the primary product lead for major, time-sensitive programs affecting the Wayfairs customer journey and Delivery Experience.

 
What Youll Need

5 + years building products or infrastructure at scale from concept to launch and beyond.
Cross-functional product leadership
Understanding of supply chain, fulfillment, and logistics processes.
Able to understand and map dependencies across tech and supply chain systems.
